Fields.DialogueText: Kapitan, you haven't been honest with me.
I haven't?
You've hidden the details of our latest mission from me.

Fields.MenuText: I just haven't gotten around to telling you.
What part of Top Secret do you not understand?
I've wanted to tell you, but I'm under orders.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, there's no time like the present.
I'm the Belle of this ship! I have to know!
I wouldn't want you to break chain of command.
I can sense that something about this mission is worrying you.
You'll learn everything soon enough. Set a course to... there.
That area is heavy with Morganas.
The Morganas are part of the plan.
Kapitan... we're together, right?

Fields.MenuText: Of course.
You know how I feel about you.
What makes you ask that?

Fields.DialogueText: Then we shouldn't be hiding things from each other.
I do. But I wish we didn't have to keep secrets.
Because if we are, I must be able to trust you.
*ALARM*
... I promise, I'll be able to talk about it soon. I don't like keeping secrets either.
@BATTLE
But, right now, we should probably deal with the murder ships.
*ALARM*
Kapitan, we've been spotted. Enemy Morganas are incoming.
Let them come.
I think it's time you told me what we're doing out here.
This is about you.
Me?
Command has become very interested in your linguistic abilities...
They wonder if you can understand the Morgana language.
Me? But no one has ever successfully communicated with Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: That's what we're here to change.
Yes, but do you think you can do it?
This is why I didn't want to tell you.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm prepared for the challenge.
I can do anything! Nothing is impossible.
Da, I understand now.
We have to get close enough to intercept a transmission between the Morganas.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Just a bit closer. Then we can intercept their transmission.
How much longer?
We've got something coming in now!
Keep fighting until we can get a full signal!
*ALARM*
More Morganas coming from our flank.
I'm... trying to figure out their language. I think that might be a... a distress call.

Fields.MenuText: Once we get the signal we can escape.
They're going to need help. We'll wipe them all out.
If this keeps up we'll need a distress signal of our own.

Fields.DialogueText: We'll hold out. There's no doubt.
Then let's keep fighting!
Nonsense! We can defeat them!
@BATTLE
Have you had time to study the Morgana signals?
I have... and their language is strange. It's primitive.
Can you decipher it?
With a bit more time, da. I am confident in my ability to do so.
Sorry I didn't tell you about the mission before.

Fields.MenuText: I was worried you wouldn't want to do it.
I had my orders from Command.
I thought it was best if you didn't know.

Fields.DialogueText: There's no mission that I fear, Kapitan.
We all have orders to follow, Kapitan.
Don't presume you know what's best for me.
People use secrets to keep you beneath them.
I don't like secrets. There are too many being kept in this war already...
Especially from women.
No more secrets between us.
@BATTLE
Command says you've been able to decipher the Morganas' language.
It's not perfect, but I believe I've come close.
They've asked me to extend another mission to you.
Another secret mission?
Yes, and I'm authorized to share the details.
Then perhaps I should be flattered.
We're tasked with trying to communicate with Morgana ships.
I'm not in this war to help with peace negotiations, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: Me neither. But this is the mission.
I don't think Command has peace in mind.
So you're passing up a chance to tell the Morganas how you feel about them?

Fields.DialogueText: As long as we get in some fighting along the way.
I see. They want to use the signal to trick the Morganas.
Actions speak louder than any words, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
I understand this message.
@BATTLE
We've set our course.
How long until we encounter any Morganas?
Not long enough, likely.
Once we engage we're going to send out a hailing transmission.
I have a better idea.
What if I tried a distress call? It might lure them to our position.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds very risky.
That might save us a lot of time searching.
Interesting. We could lead them right into a trap.

Fields.DialogueText: No more risky than anything else we do in battle.
And get us into a fight sooner!
And prove that the signal works at the same time.
Let's do it.
@BATTLE
How's the transmission coming along?
I'm sending it out, but no intelligible responses yet, Kapitan.
Maybe I don't understand their language as well as I thought...

Fields.MenuText: Have you tried sweet–talking them?
Keep trying. I have faith in you.
Or maybe the Morganas are up to something.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! I'll save that for you, Kapitan.
I'll try something different...
Could they be that clever?
*ALARM*
Morganas incoming!
It worked! They came to the distress call.
They don't look happy that we're not one of them.
@BATTLE
I think your signal worked a little too well.
Well... I might not have sent a distress signal.
I might have actually challenged them to battle.
You did what?
They would never have responded to a distress call so quickly.

Fields.MenuText: What happened to no secrets?
And now look what you've gotten us into!
And now we might need to send out a REAL distress signal soon!

Fields.DialogueText: This wasn't a secret. It was a judgment call.
A fight? Nothing we cannot handle.
Not if I have anything to say about it.
Reckless move, Kavkaz...
@BATTLE
I have an idea, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: I think you've done enough today, Kavkaz.
Hopefully it doesn't involve more fighting.
Is it a plan of escape?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sorry. But please listen...
I understand you're angry, but now is not the time, Kapitan.
Da. I can get us all to safety.
I want to send another signal to the Morganas.
What is it this time?
A call for retreat. If I can trick them, maybe they'll flee.
Can you do it?
If we stand our ground just a bit longer.
@BATTLE
I think I've figured it out, Kapitan.
Then send the false retreat signal!
Transmitting...
AAAAHHHH!!!
Kavkaz?! What's wrong? KAVKAZ!
AAHHH!! It hurts. It hurts SO MUCH! AAHHH!!
Is it the Morganas?
It's their language... It's in my head! AAARRRGGHHHH!
*ALARM*
Another attack wave!

Fields.MenuText: Kavkaz, are you all right? Are you with me?
Pull yourself together. We have to fight!
I should never have let you try this.

Fields.DialogueText: Da... I'll make it. Don't worry.
I'm trying! I can do it!
I made my own decision, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
We made it, barely...
Kavkaz, what happened when you communicated with the Morganas?
I'm... I'm not sure. Their language, it's so strange...
It was more like a feeling.
What sort of feeling?
Rage. More rage than I've ever felt.

Fields.MenuText: You really scared me. I thought I might lose you.
Could you do it again if you had to?
All that aside, the mission was a success.

Fields.DialogueText: Spasibo, but you do not need to worry about me, Kapitan.
The idea frightens me. But I'm sure I could.
Da. Da, it was.
I'm sorry if I worried you...
You have enough responsibility as kapitan without worrying about me.

Fields.MenuText: I care about you because I choose to.
It would be nice if you took fewer risks.
I'm glad you understand my position.

Fields.DialogueText: It means a lot that you would say that, Kapitan.
Haha. I will do my best.
It won't happen again, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
Command is looking for volunteers.
The mission is to provide gunfire support to some of our nearby troops.
If it's to support our comrades, I'll gladly volunteer.
I thought so. That's why I've already signed us on for the mission.
Careful, Kapitan.
About what?
Keep bringing me things I want and I might fall even harder for you.
Some women would prefer flowers to support missions.
Flowers? How boring.

Fields.MenuText: What do you have against flowers?
Ha. I suppose they're not as exciting as a battle.
What if I ever did bring you flowers?

Fields.DialogueText: They die quickly. They do not last.
Few things are, Kapitan.
I'd prefer a nice antique instead.
Real love should be lasting. Flowers die...
It makes no sense to me.
Haha. You're one of a kind, Kavkaz.
And don't you ever forget that fact.
@BATTLE
What's wrong? Why are we losing?
It's the crew, Kapitan. They aren't listening to you.
We don't have time for this!
Some of them say they won't fight...

Fields.MenuText: Then they'll be held accountable for treason.
Say something to them! Make them fight!
What can we do?

Fields.DialogueText: They aren't committing treason, Kapitan.
I... I can't...
Not we. You have to do something.
It's me...
What about you?
I've overheard them speaking before...
They resent fighting under a woman.
*ALARM*
We should ask if they'd resent being dead!
All stations, keep attacking!
@BATTLE
I have our allies in sight.
Move in! We have to provide them support.
*ALARM*
More enemy ships inbound!
Tell the crew to prepare for evasive maneuvers.
Hurry!
I've told you. They won't listen to me.

Fields.MenuText: Then make them listen!
I can't believe this is actually happening.
If we don't work together we'll all die.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine. I'll threaten them if I have to.
I'm sorry...
You have to take charge, Kapitan. Now!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
We're under heavy fire now. I am not certain of our chances.
We can hold out until a rescue comes. Keep fighting!
Kapitan... if this is the end...
Don't talk like that.
This is all my fault. If I didn't care about you...
This has nothing to do with you.
If I didn't love you... maybe the crew wouldn't hate me.
They're offended by our relationship.

Fields.MenuText: I've had enough of this crew and its insubordination.
I won't apologize for whom I love.
Then they need to understand how we feel about each other.

Fields.DialogueText: Becoming angry won't sway them, Kapitan.
Nor will I. But the crew...
How do we make them understand?
*ALARM*
ALL HANDS, ATTENTION! This is the Kapitan.
I have heard rumors that some of you refuse to support your First Comrade. If there is any truth to this, remember...
@BATTLE
We are together on one ship, and First Comrade Kavkaz represents all of us. Together.
Fight together with me, and I will lead you to victory!
We're stranded.
We'll keep fighting as long as we have to.

Fields.MenuText: We came as reinforcements. Now we need a rescue.
I'm not losing anyone today. Especially not you.
What a time for crew morale to be a problem...

Fields.DialogueText: The irony is not lost on me either.
The only ones losing today will be the enemy.
It isn't their fault, Kapitan. They just do not understand.
The enemy is rallying.
Just one more push. We can make it!
Kapitan, if we do not survive today...

Fields.MenuText: I know.
Don't talk like that!
Save it for later.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. But I'm going to tell you anyway...
You're right. We have to keep up hope.
I'm not holding out for "later"...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Is it over?
It looks that way...
Kavkaz, I'm sorry this happened to you.
It's not your fault.

Fields.MenuText: They'll fix you up. You'll be better than ever.
There will be consequences for the crew's insubordination.
If there's anything I can do...

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I will.
Punishing them won't do any good.
You've done all you can.
Once I'm repaired we'll show them.
The enemy?
No... the crew.
We'll show them we deserve their respect.
@BATTLE
I have a request, Kapitan.
Anything. Let me know what I can do.
Repairs will be finished soon...
... and then I want you to volunteer us for the most hazardous mission available.

Fields.MenuText: That sounds like suicide.
We've talked already about you being reckless.
And what if I refuse?

Fields.DialogueText: Suicide is the last thing on my mind.
Trust me, I have a plan.
If you love me, you'll understand.
We have to prove ourselves in battle to save our comrades.
You think that's the only way to win the crew over?
I know it is. Promise me you'll do it.
@BATTLE
It took some convincing, but I've gotten us a mission.
An escort mission? Seek and destroy?
Search and rescue. We are to help evacuate a group of spies...
But it's a special mission.
How so?
The spies are all women.
Female spies? That's excellent!
I thought you'd be excited.
This is perfect. We'll show everyone how capable women are in battle!

Fields.MenuText: Don't get overzealous. This won't be easy.
This time I'll make sure to keep you safe.
If this doesn't prove your worth, nothing will.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. The challenge is what excites me.
We'll keep each other safe this time.
Even so. As long as you care, that's enough for me.
@BATTLE
This is the plan of action.
While our allies are engaging the enemy in battle...
... we're going to be taking in a group of soldier evacuees.
And the spies will be among them?
Precisely. They're using the confusion of the battle to escape.
I have to admit I'm nervous about this.

Fields.MenuText: You? Nervous?
Don't be. You'll do fine.
Are you afraid of getting hurt again?

Fields.DialogueText: I know it's unusual.
With you by my side, I'm sure.
It's not that...
I think the responsibility is weighing on me.
These women are important. We could be making history.
Then let's make sure it's written our way.
@BATTLE
We're moving into position.
How is the crew behaving?
The speech a while ago helped, but they still haven't been at their best.
That's to be expected...
If they don't like taking orders from a woman...
I doubt they like the idea of helping female spies.

Fields.MenuText: They'd better get used to the idea fast.
This is no time for low morale.
Well, nothing motivates like a hard battle.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll never forgive them if we fail today.
Then let's rally their spirits.
Then let's ATTACK!
@BATTLE
Hurry. Get everyone on board!
We're clear. Everybody is aboard, Kapitan.
And the enemy remains.
Now comes the real hard part.
Good. I hate a long wait.
And not a moment too soon.
Kapitan, I do not want to add more concerns, but if we do not fight our way out soon... our ammunition and other supplies won't see us much further.

Fields.MenuText: Why do we have such bad luck?
We'll have to outrun the enemy, then.
Let's make every round count!

Fields.DialogueText: Have faith, Kapitan. Then we won't need luck.
Let's become a moving target for them, Kapitan.
We're all ready to fight by your side, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
At this rate, the enemy will overtake us.
Kavkaz, I have an idea..
Remember what you tried to do to the Morganas?
The fake retreat signal?
Right. Do you think you can do it to the enemy?
You hesitate to ask me, because you are concerned for me. I appreciate that, Kapitan, but I am capable of doing my duty.
Just get me in position to send the signal.

Fields.MenuText: And no tricks this time, please.
We're all depending on you.
This has to work, or we're done for.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course not!
I won't let any of you down.
I don't want to think about that.
We're in position! Do it.
Transmitting...
@BATTLE
It worked! We had to fight for a while, but now the rest are backing away!
You did it!
We did it, Kapitan.
The crew was behind us as well. I could see the whole crew putting in everything they had.
Our plan worked.
They may never fully approve, but I believe they do respect us.

Fields.MenuText: I'll take that small victory for now.
We'll win them over in time.
They've seen how strong you really are.

Fields.DialogueText: Any victory is worth celebrating.
If not, then we'll still have each other.
I hope they've seen how I care for each of them. The whole crew.
Do you think they've changed their minds about women soldiers as well?
One war at a time, Kapitan.
Another pack of Morganas that didn't get the message. Let's go, Kavkaz.
@BATTLE
I was thinking of something funny, Kapitan.
A joke?
No it's nothing like that...
It's just about our relationship.

Fields.MenuText: Are you breaking up with me already?
What about our relationship is funny?
Have you been thinking about us a lot?

Fields.DialogueText: Haha! Of course not.
Plenty of things...
More than I would admit to anyone else.
Do you know how many languages I can speak?
I've lost count.
Over twenty. But you know what's funny?
So many languages, and I'm still not sure if I can fully express how I feel about you.

Fields.MenuText: Your actions say more than your words ever could.
I don't speak that many, but I feel the same way.
Sweet... if ironic.

Fields.DialogueText: Do you really see that?
Haha. That actually makes me feel better.
I just want you to always know that I care.
I do love you, Kapitan.
I love you, too.
Et je t'aime. Ich liebe dich. Ti-
You know, you could just kiss me now.
Mm.
